results.title: Identification of an oral microbiota signature associated with an impaired orosensory perception of lipids in insulin-resistant patients
results.text_hl: Surprisingly, a lower @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@fatty@@@ taste perception was mainly found in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and/or statins, suggesting a possible side effect of these antidiabetic and/or hypolipidemic drugs on taste acuity.

citations.NLM: Besnard P, Christensen JE, Bernard A, Simoneau-Robin I, Collet X, Verges B, Burcelin R. Identification of an oral microbiota signature associated with an impaired orosensory perception of lipids in insulin-resistant patients Acta Diabetol. 2020 Dec;57(12):1445-1451. PMID: 32676702
citations.BibTeX: @article{32676702, title={Identification of an oral microbiota signature associated with an impaired orosensory perception of lipids in insulin-resistant patients}, author={Besnard P and Christensen JE and Bernard A and Simoneau-Robin I and Collet X and Verges B and Burcelin R}, journal={Acta Diabetol}, volume={57}, number={12}, pages={1445-1451}}

results.title: Investigation of pharmacological responses to anti-diabetic drugs in female Spontaneously Diabetic Torii (SDT) fatty rats, a new nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) model
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment significantly inhibited the @DISEASE_Hyperglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006943 @@@hyperglycemia@@@ in SDT @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@fatty@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ fed a @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@-enriched diet; however, the pharmacological potential to improve @DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@NASH@@@-like lesions is mild when compared with @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Toriniwa Y, Saito T, Miyajima K, Ishii Y, Uno K, Maekawa T, Matsui T, Kume S, Yamada T, Ohta T. Investigation of pharmacological responses to anti-diabetic drugs in female Spontaneously Diabetic Torii (SDT) fatty rats, a new nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) model J Vet Med Sci. 2018 Jun 6;80(6):878-885. PMID: 29643297
citations.BibTeX: @article{29643297, title={Investigation of pharmacological responses to anti-diabetic drugs in female Spontaneously Diabetic Torii (SDT) fatty rats, a new nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) model}, author={Toriniwa Y and Saito T and Miyajima K and Ishii Y and Uno K and Maekawa T and Matsui T and Kume S and Yamada T and Ohta T}, journal={J Vet Med Sci}, volume={80}, number={6}, pages={878-885}}

results.title: Establishment of an ex Vivo Model of Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Using a Tissue-Engineered Liver.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment of the @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@TEF@@@ @DISEASE_Liver_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D017093 @@@liver@@@ model caused reduced cellular @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglycerides@@@, activated @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@ molecule, inhibited mTORC1 signaling pathway, which thus affected the synthesis and metabolism of @CHEMICAL_Fatty_Acids_Nonesterified @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005230 @@@FFAs@@@.

citations.NLM: Wu Q, Liu J, Liu L, Chen Y, Wang J, Leng L, Yu Q, Duan Z, Wang Y. Establishment of an ex Vivo Model of Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Using a Tissue-Engineered Liver. ACS Biomater Sci Eng. 2018 Aug 13;4(8):3016-3026. PMID: 33435021
citations.BibTeX: @article{33435021, title={Establishment of an ex Vivo Model of Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Using a Tissue-Engineered Liver.}, author={Wu Q and Liu J and Liu L and Chen Y and Wang J and Leng L and Yu Q and Duan Z and Wang Y}, journal={ACS Biomater Sci Eng}, volume={4}, number={8}, pages={3016-3026}}

results.title: [Therapeutic effects of insulin-sensitizing drugs on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease: experiment with rats].
results.text_hl: The @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@fatty degeneration@@@ grades of liver tissues of the @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@rosiglitazone@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ groups were grade: 0.8 +/- 0.3 and 1.0 +/- 0.2, both significantly lower than that of the @DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@NAFLD@@@ control group (grade 2.8 +/- 0.5, both P < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Zhang DM, Zhang GY, Wang T, Zhong HJ, Chen WK. [Therapeutic effects of insulin-sensitizing drugs on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease: experiment with rats]. Zhonghua Yi Xue Za Zhi. 2006 May 16;86(18):1279-83. PMID: 16796890
citations.BibTeX: @article{16796890, title={[Therapeutic effects of insulin-sensitizing drugs on nonalcoholic fatty liver disease: experiment with rats].}, author={Zhang DM and Zhang GY and Wang T and Zhong HJ and Chen WK}, journal={Zhonghua Yi Xue Za Zhi}, volume={86}, number={18}, pages={1279-83}}

results.title: [The effect of high-dose metformin on the metabolic parameters and functional state of the liver of agouti-mice with the melanocortin obesity.]
results.text_hl: At the same time, in the liver of Agouti line @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@, the small-drop and large-drop @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@fatty degeneration@@@ and the @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@hydropic degeneration@@@ were attenuated, and the expression of pro-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ @GENE_IL1B @GENE_16176 @@@IL-1beta@@@ and pro-apoptotic @GENE_BAX @GENE_12028 @@@Bax@@@ protein and the @GENE_BAX @GENE_12028 @@@Bax@@@/@GENE_BCL2 @GENE_12043 @@@Bcl-2@@@ ratio did not differ from the control C57Bl/6J (a/a) @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Derkach KV, Romanova IV, Zorina II, Bakhtyukov AA, Perminova AA, Ivantsov AO, Shpakov AO. [The effect of high-dose metformin on the metabolic parameters and functional state of the liver of agouti-mice with the melanocortin obesity.] Adv Gerontol. 2019;32(3):431-438. PMID: 31512431
citations.BibTeX: @article{31512431, title={[The effect of high-dose metformin on the metabolic parameters and functional state of the liver of agouti-mice with the melanocortin obesity.]}, author={Derkach KV and Romanova IV and Zorina II and Bakhtyukov AA and Perminova AA and Ivantsov AO and Shpakov AO}, journal={Adv Gerontol}, volume={32}, number={3}, pages={431-438}}

results.title: [Comparison of two treatment models in type-II diabetic patients with poor metabolic control: Preformed combination of glibenclamide 2,5 mg + metformin 400 mg or mono-therapy with sulfonylurea at maximal doses? An evaluation at six months].
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@Glibenclamide@@@ stimulates @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ release by pancreatic beta cells (pancreatic attachment point), while @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ acts at a peripheral level by increasing @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ absorption in muscular, @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@fatty@@@ and hepatic tissues, thus considerably reducing @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@ (extra-pancreatic attachment point).

citations.NLM: D'Argenzio R, Cavallo P, Merante D, Morelli A. [Comparison of two treatment models in type-II diabetic patients with poor metabolic control: Preformed combination of glibenclamide 2,5 mg + metformin 400 mg or mono-therapy with sulfonylurea at maximal doses? An evaluation at six months]. Minerva Endocrinol. 1996 Sep;21(3):101-10. PMID: 9072666
citations.BibTeX: @article{9072666, title={[Comparison of two treatment models in type-II diabetic patients with poor metabolic control: Preformed combination of glibenclamide 2,5 mg + metformin 400 mg or mono-therapy with sulfonylurea at maximal doses? An evaluation at six months].}, author={D'Argenzio R and Cavallo P and Merante D and Morelli A}, journal={Minerva Endocrinol}, volume={21}, number={3}, pages={101-10}}

results.title: Three-dimensional perfused human in vitro model of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease
results.text_hl: Hepatocytes, cultured under @<m>DISEASE_Lipoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008067 @@@fatty@@@ conditions and treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, had a reduced cellular @GENE_FAT1 @GENE_2195 @@@fat@@@ content compared to untreated controls and consumed less @CHEMICAL_Fatty_Acids_Nonesterified @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005230 @@@FFA@@@ from cell culture medium.

citations.NLM: Kostrzewski T, Cornforth T, Snow SA, Ouro-Gnao L, Rowe C, Large EM, Hughes DJ. Three-dimensional perfused human in vitro model of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease World J Gastroenterol. 2017 Jan 14;23(2):204-215. PMID: 28127194
citations.BibTeX: @article{28127194, title={Three-dimensional perfused human in vitro model of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease}, author={Kostrzewski T and Cornforth T and Snow SA and Ouro-Gnao L and Rowe C and Large EM and Hughes DJ}, journal={World J Gastroenterol}, volume={23}, number={2}, pages={204-215}}
